snippet: Militants are seeking to capitalize on growing anger over the killings of civilians in drone strikes.
abstract: Ansar al-Shariah, affiliate group of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, is using stream of online videos to accuse Yemeni Army and its American allies for killing bystanders in their drone attacks and military campaigns targeting suspected militants; propaganda push comes after years of Western condemnation for civilian casualties of terrorist attacks.

byline.original: By SAEED AL BATATI and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Saeed al Batati reported from Mukalla, Yemen, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Militants are seeking to capitalize on growing anger over the killings of civilians in drone strikes.

headline.main: Qaeda Affiliate Steps Up Video Propaganda Push
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Affiliate Steps Up Video Propaganda Push

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
keywords.name: organizations
